L.S: A) addition of water vapor to the air
D) removal of water vapor from the air

Question.S: Which of the following forces can not act to change the speed of the wind?

Answer.S: B) more rapidly in the vertical direction than in the horizontal

L.S: A) more rapidly in the horizontal direction than in the vertical
B) more rapidly in the vertical direction than in the horizontal
C) at the same rate in the horizontal and vertical directions
D) more rapidly in the vertical over land than over the ocean

Question.S: An abrupt change in wind speed or wind direction is called:

C) the paths taken by ocean currents
D) the position of the continents

Question.S: On a 500 millibar chart ____ are drawn to represent horizontal changes in altitude  which correspond to horizontal changes in pressure.
A change of one degree on the Celsius scale is ________ a change of one degree on the  Fahrenheit scale.

L.S: D) is in the opposite direction of

Question.S: Supercell thunderstorms that produce tornadoes form in a region of strong wind shear. Explain how the wind usually changes in speed and direction to produce this shear.

Answer.S: Rapidly increasing wind speed with height provides vertical wind speed shear and the changing wind direction with height - from southerly at low levels to westerly at high levels - provides wind direction shear which induces the updrafts inside the storms to rotate.
A) acts to reinforce an initial change

L.S: A) acts to reinforce an initial change
B) acts to weaken or oppose an initial change
C) will cause a positive change
D) will cause a negative change

L.S: A) a much higher temperature than -10¬∞C
B) a much lower temperature than -10¬∞C
